description: Retention of an outbuilding to rear garden. (Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development for an Existing Development)
decision_conditions: The existing outbuilding used for ancillary purposes does not require planning permission by reason of Sections 2 and 4 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990: Section 191 as amended by section 10 of the Planning Compensation Act 1991, as the Applicant has been able to demonstrate that the Development described has been in existence and has been constantly used as such for a period of at least 4 years prior to the date of this application.

The existing outbuilding used for ancillary purposes does not require planning permission by reason of Sections 2 and 4 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990: Section 191 as amended by section 10 of the Planning Compensation Act 1991, as the Applicant has been able to demonstrate that the Development described has been in existence and has been constantly used as such for a period of at least 4 years prior to the date of this application.

The use of the outbuilding hereby confirmed as approved is for the purposes stated on the application form as ancillary accommodation. Future use of the outbuilding for purposes such as a bedroom, kitchen, or as a separate unit of accommodation constitutes a primary use that is not incidental and likely to invalidate this certificate. Furthermore, the Local Planning Authority may pursue enforcement against breaches of planning control, which may involve legal action through the Courts
